title: Data Novice
subtitle: Foundation of Business Data Analysis
description: Master the fundamental tools and concepts that every Data Analyst needs. Learn to transform raw data into actionable business insights using spreadsheets.
learning_outcomes: Understand different data types and their business applications
Master advanced Excel/Sheets formulas for data manipulation
Apply conditional logic to solve business problems
Create dynamic lookups across multiple data sources
Build basic data validation and quality checks

modules.topic: Understanding Data Types in Business Context
modules.description: Learn to identify and properly handle different data types: text, numbers, dates, booleans, and categorical data. Understand why data types matter for analysis accuracy and business reporting.
key_concepts: Numeric vs Text data and conversion pitfalls
Date/Time formats across different regions (ISO 8601)
Boolean logic in business decision-making
Categorical vs Continuous variables
Data type coercion and its dangers

case_study.title: The $125 Million Spreadsheet Error
case_study.scenario: A multinational retail company discovered that their quarterly revenue report was off by $125 million. The root cause? A junior analyst imported European sales data where commas are used as decimal separators (â‚¬1.234,56) into a US-formatted spreadsheet. Your task: Analyze the corrupted dataset, identify all data type mismatches, and create a standardized data cleaning protocol.
deliverables: List of all data type inconsistencies found
Written protocol for future data imports

modules.topic: Advanced Conditional Logic: IF, IFS, AND, OR, NOT
modules.description: Master conditional functions to automate business decision logic. Learn to nest conditions efficiently and avoid common logical errors that cost companies millions.
key_concepts: Single IF statements with proper TRUE/FALSE handling
Nested IF vs IFS for multiple conditions
Combining AND, OR, NOT for complex logic
SWITCH function for cleaner multi-condition handling
Error handling with IFERROR and IFNA

case_study.title: E-Commerce Discount Engine
case_study.scenario: An online fashion retailer wants to automate their discount logic. They have 5 customer tiers (Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, VIP), 3 product categories (Regular, Sale, Clearance), and seasonal multipliers. Build a formula engine that calculates the final price considering: (1) Base tier discount (5-25%), (2) Category restrictions (Clearance items excluded from tier discounts), (3) Seasonal sale stackability rules, (4) Minimum purchase thresholds for discount activation.
deliverables: Dynamic pricing formula that handles all scenarios

modules.topic: Lookup Functions: VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, XLOOKUP
modules.description: Connect data across multiple tables efficiently. Understand when to use each lookup method and why INDEX-MATCH and XLOOKUP are superior for production use.
key_concepts: VLOOKUP basics and its critical limitations
Why approximate match is almost always wrong
INDEX-MATCH as the professional's choice
XLOOKUP: The modern replacement
Handling #N/A errors gracefully
Performance considerations for large datasets

case_study.title: Customer 360 Dashboard
case_study.scenario: A B2B SaaS company has customer data scattered across 4 different systems: CRM (customer details), Billing (subscription info), Support (ticket history), and Product (usage metrics). Build a unified Customer 360 view that pulls data from all sources using a single customer_id. Handle cases where customers exist in some systems but not others. Calculate a 'Health Score' based on: payment history, support ticket frequency, and product usage trends.
deliverables: Unified customer view with all data sources

modules.description: Master text manipulation functions to clean messy real-world data. Learn to extract, transform, and standardize text data from various sources.
key_concepts: LEFT, RIGHT, MID for text extraction
TRIM, CLEAN for whitespace and non-printable characters
UPPER, LOWER, PROPER for standardization
CONCATENATE vs CONCAT vs TEXTJOIN
TEXT function for formatting numbers/dates as text
Regular expression basics with REGEXMATCH, REGEXEXTRACT (Google Sheets)

case_study.title: CRM Data Migration Nightmare
case_study.scenario: A company is migrating from an old CRM to Salesforce. The legacy data has severe quality issues: names in 'LASTNAME, FIRSTNAME' format, phone numbers with inconsistent formatting (some with country codes, some without, some with dashes, some with spaces), addresses not split into proper fields, and email addresses mixed with notes in the same cell. Clean the dataset to Salesforce-ready format with separate First Name, Last Name, Phone (E.164 format), Street, City, State, ZIP, and Email fields.
deliverables: Cleaned dataset matching Salesforce import template
Data quality report (% of records with issues)

modules.description: Unlock the power of array formulas to perform complex calculations that would otherwise require multiple helper columns or VBA. Introduction to the new dynamic array paradigm.
key_concepts: Traditional array formulas (Ctrl+Shift+Enter legacy)
Dynamic arrays: FILTER, SORT, SORTBY, UNIQUE
SEQUENCE and RANDARRAY for data generation
Spilling behavior and # references
Combining array functions for advanced analysis
LET function for readable complex formulas

case_study.title: Sales Territory Optimization
case_study.scenario: A pharmaceutical sales organization needs to analyze territory performance dynamically. Build a dashboard that allows users to: (1) Filter sales reps by region using dropdowns, (2) Automatically sort results by revenue or growth rate, (3) Identify the top 5 products per territory, (4) Calculate territory-level metrics without pivot tables. The solution must update automatically when data is added - no manual refresh.

modules.topic: Level 1 Final Challenge: Complete Business Analysis
modules.description: Apply all Level 1 skills in a comprehensive business scenario. You will be graded by AI on correctness, efficiency, style, and business insight.

case_study.title: Startup Runway Analysis
case_study.scenario: You are a Data Analyst at a Series A startup. The CEO needs an urgent analysis for the board meeting tomorrow. Given the company's financial data (monthly burn rate, revenue by customer, team headcount, and pending deals), build a complete financial model that answers: (1) What is our current runway in months? (2) Which customers contribute most to revenue (Pareto analysis)? (3) If we close the pending deals, how does runway change? (4) At what growth rate do we become cash-flow positive? The model must be dynamic - the CEO wants to adjust assumptions and see results immediately.
deliverables: Dynamic runway calculator with adjustable assumptions

certification.credential_text: Completed Data Academy Level 1: Data Novice (Analyst Track)
